oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hydroxyalkylation of conjugated nitroalkenes with activated nonenolizable carbonyl compounds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DEB, INDUBHUSAN
DADWAL, MAMTA
SHAIKH, MOBIN M
NAMBOOTHIRI, IRISHI NN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: morita-baylis hilman reaction
acetonitrile
activated carbon
conjugated
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Morita-Baylis-Hillman reaction of a variety of conjugated nitroalkenes with activated nonenolizable carbonyl compounds such as glyoxylate, trifluoropyruvate, pyruvaldehyde, and ninhydrin in the presence of 40-100 mol % of DMAP in acetonitrile or 100 mol % of imidazole in CHCl3 or THF provided the adducts in decent to good yields. In most cases, the reactions catalyzed by DMAP in acetonitrile were faster and provided the desired MBH adducts in higher yields as compared to the imidazole catalyzed reactions.
